Text: By the dust scattering winds;
then by the heavy laden clouds;
then by their swift gliding;
then by those who distribute the big affair (rain);
surely, that which you are being promised is true;
and surely, the Day of Judgment shall come to pass.
By the sky full of orbits,
surely you contradict one another in what you say,
only the perverse persons turn away from the truth.
Woe to those who judge by conjecture,
those who are engulfed in ignorance and heedlessness.
They ask: "when will the Day of Judgment be?"
It will be the Day when they will be punished in the fire,
and it will said: "Taste your chastisement! This is what you were\n\t\t\tseeking to haste."
As to the righteous, they will be in the midst of gardens and\n\t\t\tsprings,
joyfully receiving what their Rabb shall give them; for they were\n\t\t\tbefore that (during their life on earth) righteous people,
They used to sleep but little in the night time,
pray for forgiveness in the early morning,
and share their wealth with the needy who asked for it, and those\n\t\t\twho could not ask.
In the earth, there are signs for the firm believers,
and also in your own selves; can you not see?
In heaven is your sustenance and all that you are promised.
I swear by the Rabb of heaven and earth that this is true, as\n\t\t\tcertain as you are speaking now!
Have you heard the story of Ibrahim's honored guests?
When they came to him and said: "Peace be upon you!" "Peace be\n\t\t\tupon you also!", he answered, and seeing that they were\n\t\t\tstrangers,
he went quietly to his family, brought a roasted calf
and placed it before them saying: "Will you not eat?"
When he saw them not eating, he became afraid of them. They said:\n\t\t\t"Have no fear," and they gave him good news of a son endowed with\n\t\t\tknowledge.
Hearing this his wife came forward, with astonishment she smote\n\t\t\ther forehead and said: "A son to a barren old woman!"
They replied: "Thus has said your Rabb: surely He is the Wise,\n\t\t\tthe Knowledgeable."
JUZ (PART): 27\t   Ibrahim (Abraham) asked: "O Divine Messengers,\n\t\t\twhat is your errand?"
They replied: "We have been sent to a guilty nation (people of\n\t\t\tLot, who were homosexuals),
to shower upon them brimstone,
marked by your Rabb for the transgressors."
Then We saved all those who were believers in the town
- We found none but one household of true Muslims
- We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful\n\t\t\tpunishment.
There is also a sign for you in the story of Musa (Moses): when\n\t\t\tWe sent him to Fir'on (Pharaoh) with clear authority,
but he turned his back along with his chiefs, saying: "He (Moses)\n\t\t\tis a sorcerer or a madman."
Consequently, We seized him and his warriors, and cast them into\n\t\t\tthe sea. Indeed he deserved much blame.
There is also a sign in the story of 'Ad: when We let loose on\n\t\t\tthem a blighting wind
which made rotten everything that it blew on.
Likewise the story of Thamud, when it was said to them: "Enjoy\n\t\t\tyourselves for a while,"
but they disobeyed the commandment of their Rabb; consequently\n\t\t\tthey were overtaken by the thunderbolt even while they were\n\t\t\tlooking on.
So neither they could stand up on their feet nor could they\n\t\t\tdefend themselves.
And We destroyed the people of Nuh (Noah) before them because\n\t\t\tthey too were transgressors.
We have built the heavens with Our hands, for We have the power\n\t\t\tto do so.
We have spread out the earth; how excellent a spreader We are!
We have created everything in pairs, so that you may learn a\n\t\t\tlesson from it.
O Prophet, say to mankind: "Rush towards Allah, surely I am\n\t\t\tassigned by Him as a plain Warner to you all.
Do not set up another god besides Allah, surely I am assigned by\n\t\t\tHim as a plain Warner to you all."
It has been the case that whenever a Rasool came to the peoples\n\t\t\tbefore them, they said about him: "He is a sorcerer or a madman."
Have they transmitted this statement from one generation to the\n\t\t\tnext? Nay, but they are all a rebellious people.
So, O Prophet, ignore them; you are not at fault.
But keep on admonishing them, for admonition is beneficial to the\n\t\t\ttrue believers.
We have not created jinns and mankind except to worship Me.
I require no sustenance from them, nor do I ask that they should\n\t\t\tfeed Me.
Surely it is Allah Who is the giver of all sustenance, the Lord\n\t\t\tof Power, the Invincible.
Surely those who are wrongdoers, shall have their portion of\n\t\t\ttorment similar to the portion of their predecessors; so let them\n\t\t\tnot challenge Me to hurry it on.
Woe then to the unbelievers, on that Day with which they are\n\t\t\tbeing threatened!
